explanations.A: Not quite. Start by doing 10 x 10. Then multiply by 10 and then by 10 again.
explanations.B: Nearly! Start by doing 10 x 10. Then multiply by 10 and then by 10 again.
explanations.C: Starting with 10 x 10 = 100. Then multiply by 10 again, 100 x 10 = 1000. Then multiply by 10 again: 1000 x 10 = 10,000.
explanations.D: Start by doing 10 x 10. Then multiply by 10 and then by 10 again.

explanations.A: Not quite. Start by doing 10 x 10. Then multiply by 10 again...
explanations.B: Start by doing 10 x 10. Then multiply by 10 again...
explanations.C: Starting with 10 x 10 = 100. Then multiply by 10 again, 100 x 10 = 1000.
explanations.D: Nearly! Start by doing 10 x 10. Then multiply by 10 again...

explanations.B: This would be correct for 10³, but we just want 10² (10 squared).
explanations.D: 10² (10 squared), means multiply 10 by itself. Therefore, 10² = 10 x 10.

explanations.A: 10³ (10 cubed), means multiply 10 by itself three times...
explanations.B: 10³ (10 cubed), means multiply 10 by itself three times. Therefore, 10³ = 10 x 10 x 10.
explanations.C: This would be correct for 10⁴, but we just want 10³ (10 cubed).
explanations.D: 10³ (10 cubed), means multiply 10 by itself three times...

explanations.A: 10³ (10 cubed) means multiply 10 by itself and then by itself again.
explanations.B: 10³ (10 cubed) means multiply 10 by itself and then by itself again. Therefore, 10³ = 10 x 10 x 10 = 1,000
explanations.C: 10³ (10 cubed) means multiply 10 by itself and then by itself again.
explanations.D: This would be correct for 10⁴, but we just want 10³ (10 cubed).

explanations.A: 10⁴ means multiply 10 by itself four times. Therefore, 10⁴ = 10 x 10 x 10 x 10 = 10,000
explanations.B: 10⁴ means multiply 10 by itself four times...
explanations.C: 10⁴ means multiply 10 by itself four times...
explanations.D: This would be correct for 10³, but we want 10⁴...

This would only be correct if we were multiplying 10 by 1000. But the star represents an exponent, that is how many times we are multiplying 10 by itself. For example, 10² = 10x10 = 100; 10³ = 10x10x10 = 1,000.

explanations.A: This would only be correct if we were multiplying 10 by 100,000. But the star represents an exponent, that is how many times we are multiplying 10 by itself. For example, 10² = 10x10 = 100; 10³ = 10x10x10 = 1,000 etc.
